It's no doubt built a compelling universe filled with brain-sucking aliens that masquerade as humans, and it attempts plenty else besides: bouncing between bodies as you stealth around dingy apartment blocks, fighting with blood katanas, and gorging on pools of red plasma to refuel skills, many of which require more body-flitting. Thing is, they are ultimately just attempts, attempts that fall victim to an emptiness and jitteriness that quickly reveals Slitterhead's true, irritating form.
Read more
articles.title: Slitterhead review: body-hopping action horror that's best left dispossessed

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I didn’t get much further in the extremely popular beta for the haute-couture-asaurus action of Monster Hunter Wilds than perfecting the exact orange-to-white ratio of my cat. Not because I wasn’t having fun, but because I immediately started looking up GPU prices after playing for ten minutes. As such, I didn’t spend enough time with the combat to get a proper feel for it. Cultural osmosis has once again allowed me to form an uneducated take, however, and I’m getting the sense there’s been some mixed reactions re: bonk quality. According to a clip shared on X by user Blue Stigma, there's a good reason for those misgivings. It's all about frames, you see.
Read more
articles.title: No, you're not imagining Monster Hunter Wilds' beta combat feeling off  - there's a good reason for it

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
One of my lesser quality tests for an RPG is whether the shopkeepers complain at you for not buying anything. Grumpy shopkeepers, good RPG. This most specific of litmus tests has served me well, although I must admit that I’d happily upgrade it to ‘shopkeepers you can attack’, would that not disqualify 99% of games. But not turn based dungeon crawler Thysiastery, it turns out. This “dungeon crawler RPG featuring traditional roguelike and turn-based gameplay” apparently trusts you enough to let you recklessly batter its friendly wandering lizard merchants. You’d be a monster for it, of course, but it’s nice to have options.
Read more
articles.title: Thysiastery is an anime Legend Of Grimrock, and you can attack the dinosaur merchants if you’re a complete monster

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Put your hand up if you'd forgotten that every Assassin's Creed game is, strictly speaking, set in the present day. I know I had. That's not the actual distant past you're parkouring through. That isn't actual Renaissance architecture you're clambering on. It's a holographic Animus simulation, conjured from ancestral memories flash-frozen within your DNA - convenient, inasmuch as it means that any inconsistencies are your DNA's fault, not Ubisoft's. If the ledge-mantling animations are glitchy, that's simply because you have bad genes.
We can both be forgiven for losing sight of Assassin's Creed's modern day narrative frame. Ubisoft themselves have downplayed it since the era of Desmond Miles, the watery Peter Parker figure who served as puppetmaster protagonist for AC games up to Assassin's Creed 3. In Assassin's Creed Shadows, however, they're planning to bring back the modern day setting in a big way, though details are scanty.
 Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows will reboot Assassin's Creed's patchy modern-day story

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
SCENE. A Video Game Website At Sunrise.
Enter A Reader Of News
A Reader Of News I wonder whither there be'est any new PC games on sale this week, perchance?
Enter A News Editor, With Alarums And Excursions
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sunday is cancelled. Book for now!
 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Solipsism Xtreme Edition

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
It's official: I am once again the Sunday correspondent around here. That means it falls to me to round up (mostly) good (mostly) writing about (mostly) video games. I will otherwise be spending my Sunday continuing the fight against my dog's fleas, which rebound every three weeks no matter how much I spray, scrub or throw things away.  
On, the independent video game magazine which I linked to last week, has run a series of brief interviews with each of the contributors to its launch issue. I recommend Christian Donlan's for the puzzle game recommendations and Margaret Robertson's which expands on her fascination with Japanese paper games.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
BioWare currently has no plans for Dragon Age: The Veilguard expansions, according to reports. Instead the studio will support the fantasy RPG with smaller updates and otherwise turn their full attention towards Mass Effect 5.

 
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard won't get expansions, reports say, as BioWare move to the next Mass Effect

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Elder Scrolls: Legends, the free-to-play card game set in Bethesda's fantasy world, has been removed from sale on Steam. Its servers will shut down for good on January 30th, 2025, after which it will no longer be playable. The closure comes five years after the game was last updated.

 
Read more
articles.title: Elder Scrolls: Legends has been removed from sale and will become unplayable in January 2025

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Typing Of The Dead released in arcades 25 years ago remains a masterpiece - funny, absurd, tense, and novel. I am keen on any game that aims to follow in its footsteps, and there are a few. The latest is Blood Typers, a horror game where you tippity-tap on your keyboard to fight montsters in a spooky mansion, but this isn't a rail shooter, so you'll be typing to explore and navigate, too.

It's now got a release of February 2025, and there's a demo you can play now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Typing Of The Dead meets Resident Evil with co-op in Blood Typers, which has a demo you can play now

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Okay, look folks, I'm terribly sorry you've been trapped in the bubble of silence for this weekend while comments are still un-fucking themselves. I'm expecting some really juicy catch-up comments next weekend! In the meantime, this post will stay up as usual so you can at least hear what we're getting up to in the treehouse.
Congratulations on making it to another checkpoint, fellow traveller. Please spend your hard-earned coin on one of the following bonuses: either a weekend of games but no sleep; a weekend of sleep but no games; or a weekend of health and activity but nothing to post in the comments below? Your choice! Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend.
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Like a plague doctor delicately administering another handful of leeches, Ice Pick Lodge have shared a bit more about the recently announced Pathologic 3, explaining how their plans for the cult epidemic-battling series have progressed since the release of Pathologic 2.
Read more
articles.title: Pathologic 3 devs keen to avoid "premature promises" about bringing back the Changeling in Pathologic 4

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
People have asked me, a Call Of Duty liker, "How's the new COD?" - such is the mass appeal of Call Of Duty that even a lot of my non-industry pals are invested in whether Black Ops 6's shooty really does bang. And every single time my brain clunks into gear and I turn inwards, where I struggle to come up with anything meaningful to say. So much so that a fog develops and out of the fog emerges a figure - it's me. I'm holding an M4A1 with an extended barrel and a vertical foregrip. My brain and body perform a pincer movement of physical response: 1) I shrug 2) I say, "It's like Call Of Duty".
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 multiplayer review: it's like Call Of Duty

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
There’s plenty that you could justifiably expect from a Bioware RPG: chats with mates, opportunities to get those mates horribly killed, surviving mates turning to the side then walking offscreen. But I don’t think anyone expected Dragon Age: The Veilguard to be, at least on a purely technical level, one of the smoothest-performing, settings-rich AAA PC releases of the year so far.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard on PC is the surprise AAA tech success of 2024

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Stroll on down to Uncle Capcom's garage, girls and boys, because it's time to meddle with a cat's voicebox, ride a combat peacock and meticulously injure a vast, blubbery teddybear. By which I mean, the Monster Hunter Wilds beta is now live on Steam through to 4th November at 2.59am GMT. That's 2.59am sharp. If you're hurrying along at 3am on Monday absolutely desperate to polish the aesthetics of a small enslaved catperson, you can sod off and play Dragon Age: The Veilguard instead.
 
Read more
articles.title: The Monster Hunter Wilds beta is live with an early glimpse of the new camping, wound and weather systems

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Remedy's Alan Wake 2 has now "recouped most of its development and marketing expenses", CEO Tero Virtala has announced in a business review for January-September 2024. Speaking as somebody who would quite like there to be more Alan Wake games - or at least, moderately weird and pretty decent blockbuster singleplayer horror games - I am both pleased by this news and a little troubled that Remedy's eldritch forest fable (which came out in October 2023) has yet to break even.

 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 still hasn't quite made its money back, according to Remedy's latest financials

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Some days, I wonder if every word written before a trailer is actually superfluous. It’s a visual medium, after all. What can a description achieve save to clumsily gesture at the true shape of something; a dog-eared tour brochure for a thrilling weekend spelunking in Plato’s cave? I can usually shake this feeling, but gory zombie action game Showa American Story is my breaking point. There is nothing I can impart about this thing that will not be conveyed better by allowing its new trailer to wash over you like a tide of sheer videogame. Here’s it:
Read more
articles.title: Showa American Story is Yakuza: Dead Souls meets Tokyo Gore Police, and it looks incredible

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Real gamblers play russian roulette with shotguns. That is the core concept of Buckshot Roulette, the Inscryption-looking game of blinksweat and bulletworry. It's been out for a while now but the developers have just added a fun extra - a 4-person multiplayer mode. 
Read more
articles.title: Buckshot Roulette now has a 4-person multiplayer mode, which I'm sure you will survive

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Some extremely fresh vintage workwear that I bought for entirely practical reasons aside, I’m not exactly a fashion person. I have nobody to impress most days but my cat, and the only item of clothing she appears to have an opinion on is my Oodie, which is very comfortable for both of us and also smells like a chicken shop, which I imagine is more pleasant for her than me.
This aside, I found myself taking a whole bunch of Dragon Age: The Veilguard screenshots as I played just to capture the RPG’s various outfits. They are ridiculous. Incredibly intricate and detailed, as well as being obscenely impractical for the most part. I do not like any of them in the sense I would wear them, but I like all of them in the sense that they display artists allowed to run free like caffeinated weasels and indulge their every whim.
Read more
articles.title: I am deeply enamoured by Dragon Age: The Veilguard's intricate and ridiculous fashion design

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Steam Deck is something of a talisman for gaming on Linux, its popularity and penguin-powered SteamOS having almost singlehandedly dragged it past MacOS as the second-most-used operating system among Steam users. Sadly, this also means the Valve handheld is the primary casualty when developers decide to stop bothering with Linux support, as Respawn Entertainment have decided to do for Apex Legends.
Read more
articles.title: Respawn have killed Apex Legends' Steam Deck support in the name of anti-cheat

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
You remember Lucas Pope, right? He who casually dropped two of the most influential puzzle games ever then got distracted by yellow cranks for six years, occasionally popping up to drop a demake of Papers Please? Well, Pope has ceased hogging that crank, for now at least, and just released Haloween-y adventure game Moida Mansion. It’s on Itch here, and it’s completely free to play in your browser.
Read more
articles.title: Moida Mansion is the new free game from Return Of The Obra Dinn’s Lucas Pope, and it's out now

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Part of the fun of Dragon Age's fantasy is that it's inconsistent - or at least, inconsistent by the standards of fantasy RPGs, which often break down into a million neatly organised and interlocking codex entries. It all rides on who you speak to. The humans believe one thing about the origins and workings of Thedas, the elves another, the qunari something else entirely. These differences are the basis for many factional disagreements and thus, many core series plot developments. According to former lead writer David Gaider, however, there's an "uber-plot" behind it all that may one day be resolved and bring the series to a close, assuming BioWare continue to refer to his original (and closely guarded) narrative documents.
 
Read more
articles.title: The trick to Dragon Age's lore is that the lore is lying, says original "uber-plot" writer David Gaider

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Inflexion Games are closing their UK office, laying off staff and restructuring their main Canadian studio after failing to find commercial success with their Victorian fantasy survival game Nightingale. Reportedly, at least 22 people have been let go.
 Read more
articles.title: Nightingale can't outfly "the stark realities of the industry" as creators Inflexion close UK office and lay people off

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Stationeers and Icarus developers RocketWerkz are making a spiritual successor to beloved space sim Kerbal Space Program, which is currently titled "Kitten Space Agency" in a flagrant display of adherence to wholesome internet trends. It's based on an actual Kerbal Space Program 2 pitch the studio threw at Take-Two subsidiary Private Division back in the day. RocketWerkz CEO and original DayZ creator Dean Hall has hired several former KSP and KSP2 developers to work on the game, and is describing it on social media as a "KSP killer".
  
Read more
articles.title: DayZ creator reveals a "Kerbal Space Program killer" with kittens and challenges license owners to sue him

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
From developers Cannibal Interactive, the creators of Purgatory Dungeoneer, springs forth a new labyrinth game. This one is called Labyrinth of Wild Abyss: LayeRedux and it has labyrinths. Except the labyrinths don't just have single paths to their centres, but tube monsters covered in eyes who'll stalk you slowly and methodically as you meander. Personally, it's not the vibe I'm after when I sit down in the evening and I think, "I would like to play a video game that makes me feel somewhat pleasant". But hey, it might be for you.
Read more
articles.title: Only toilets will save you from the monsters in Labyrinth of Wild Abyss

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Almost ten years after Inquistion offered up a thrilling herb-harvesting adventure, today sees the release of Dragon Age: Veilguard. I’ve popped the release times below. The internet's Aged Dragons are naturally quite excited, and there’s been some lovely interactions over on Le Epic Musk Zone, where veteran Bioheads are celebrating the RPG studio’s history of animation quirks, specifically the ‘Bioware Turn’. Here’s a clip:
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard releases today,  and players are celebrating the famous ‘Bioware Turn’

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Today in "person you already like says something you already agree with, but it’s still good to hear them say it" news, Arkane founder and im-simmy RPG studio WolfEye head Raphael Colantonio has spoken on Microsoft’s decision to shutter Prey (2017) studio Arkane Austin - alongside a handful of others - back in May.
Colantonio, who founded Arkane in 1999 and departed in 2017 to form Weird West studio WolfEye, recently chatted to Jeremy Peel for PC Gamer about Arkane’s closure, saying:
I think if you look a little bit, it's obvious that Arkane Austin was a very special group of people that have made some cool things and that could pull it off again. I think it was a decision that just came down to, 'We need to cut something.' Was it to please the investors, the stock market? They're playing a different game.
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft closing Arkane Austin was “stupid”, says founder: recreating “a very special group” like that would be “impossible”

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
One of my favourite satires is the Screwtape Letters, an epistolary novel by Narnia scribe C.S. Lewis. It consists of messages from an oily elder demon to his nephew about how to correctly groom the soul of an unsuspecting human being. It's a claustrophobic send-up of managerial politics and nepotism, with World War 1 unfolding in the background. A real pick-me-up. Sintopia is the Two Point incarnation of that premise - in other words, brighter and breezier and definitely more slapstick than Christian. It puts you in charge of a world divided between Earth and hell, and challenges you to ensure a steady movement of optimally sinful souls between one and the other. Say your prayers and watch the trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: In strategy game Sintopia you harvest a whole civilisation's souls for your own custom-built hell

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I never completed the original Red Dead Redemption, but not for the usual reasons of being terrible at the game, or thinking that open worlds are too big and boring these days and I just want to lie down forever and watch anime. I never finished it because my Xbox 360 version was not, in practice, an open world game, but a lonely farm at the bottom of a vortex of butchered spacetime. In the prologue, reformed outlaw John Marston confronts an old bandit acquaintance and gets himself roundly shot to bits. He’s rescued by local rancher Bonnie MacFarlane, who nurses him back to health and gives him a few odd jobs to warm him up for the next plot point. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Hello Rockstar, please make an open world based on my unplayable Xbox edition of Red Dead Redemption

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Classic god sims like Populous and Black & White teach that deities love to reach their horrible holy hands into our world and mess with us directly. They teach us to see 1-1 divine intervention in every random house fire and every lightning bolt that miraculously strikes our enemies. By contrast, the forthcoming Zero Orders Tactics teaches that god prefers to operate via covert means, because after all, personally lobbing some electricity at somebody would be inelegant. It's far more graceful to trap them behind a mountain, instead.
 
Read more
articles.title: Zero Orders Tactics is a clever turn-based god sim with a touch of From Dust

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Hark! Comments have been temporarily turned off on Rock Paper Shotgun. We and all of our sibling websites are moving to a new commenting platform and the existing comments need to be ported across. This process will take some time - days, perhaps - and we'll update this post once it's complete and commenting functionality has been restored.

 
Read more
articles.title: We've temporarily closed comments for maintenance, but they'll be back

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
"Worthless,’ they'd declared. Most NFTs were ‘worthless.’ The greatest artistic movement since The Big BSoD, the greatest proof of the power of the blockchain, the very future of the whole funging Infobahn, and the hedgie soybean-counters say it's all ‘worthless’," once wrote the greatest living prophet of our era.
Now, in an entirely predictable case of "I am once again asking our tech overlords to watch the whole movie", those plucky chancers at Ubisoft have lifted AliceO’s ideas wholesale, ignored her timely and cogent commentary, and released a roiling puke reservoir of NFT upchuck masquerading as a game. Thank you Ian Games for the spot. You are the Neal Stephenson to AliceO’s William Gibson, but for worthless crap. (The IGN piece has some very good context and is worth reading).
Read more
articles.title: Champions Tactics: Grimoria Chronicle makes good on Ubisoft’s threat to coil out hot steaming NFT garbage straight into my innocent eyes

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The line between escapist entertainment and Problematic fantasy can be thin, but I think Indiana Jones's dislike for the German National Socialist Party of the 1930s and 1940s is fairly clearcut. "Nazis - I hate these guys!" he says in Raiders Of The Lost Ark. Let's play Devil's Advocate and try to Lionel Hutz that quote: "Nazis? I hate these guys!" [pointing at some Communists]. Yeah, I'm not really feeling it.
I guess Indiana did sleep with a Nazi once, but only by accident, and yes he did once cosplay as an SS officer and get Hitler's autograph, but again, only by accident. Aww, he's such a ditz! I think his political stance is abundantly obvious in Indiana Jones And The Great Circle - the new Wolfenslike from MachineGames, in which you will blast and bludgeon literally hundreds of Shitlerites in unambiguously one-sided first-person view. So it's amusing, if not wholly unexpected, that MachineGames and Bethesda have slapped the game with an explicit disclaimer stating that the game's depictions of Nazis are not, in fact, Nazi propaganda.
 Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones doesn't "endorse" Nazis, Bethesda assure, just in case you were confused by him repeatedly murdering them

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Sony have shut down Firewalk Studios, the developers behind ill-fated multiplayer hero shooter Concord, and confirmed that the game will not be returning to stores. In doing so, they are effectively striking a line through a big, red $200 million in their books - a number that some report is only part of the loss. 
Read more
articles.title: Sony write off ill-fated $200 million shooter Concord as a loss by closing studio permanently

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
PUBG Corporation and Krafton have just gone and announced Project Arc, a top-down 5v5 shooter "inspired by PUBG". To be honest with you, it looks more inspired by Rainbow Six Siege with what looks to be one team aiming to hack a crypt by breaking down defences, while the other reinforces structures to prevent them from doing that. There's also a big emphasis on sightlines, too, where gaining or robbing an enemy team's vision is crucial to blatting them in the head with lead. It looks interesting! If a difficult sell, given the fact it's yet another 5vs5 shooter…
Read more
articles.title: The PUBG developers' new PVP shooter looks like top-down Rainbow Six Siege with a bit of Hotline Miami

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
If I am ever murdered, please do not ask Max Caulfield to investigate. I've already written our review for Life Is Strange: Double Exposure, in which I celebrated the touching moments of Max's return to the series, and lamented the clunky plot that she finds herself in. In this adventure game, you're looking into the killing of a close friend, shot by an unknown assailant. You hop between two dimensions to solve the case - one world in which your pal still lives and the other in which she's dead. Unfortunately for the murder victim, you play a bona fide hot mess who could not perform a cross examination if she were standing in front of a crucifix with a magnifying glass. 
Read more
articles.title: Max Caulfield is a terrible detective - I wish her all the best

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
When they’re not doing environmental art for projects like Wasteland 3, The Brotherhood have a history making enticingly odd games. Sin very nearly liked Stasis: Bone Totem, landing positive despite giving up after several hours. That’s also my experience with Beautiful Desolation - an isometric RPG I got a real kick out of the art for before also stopping one day and just accidentally never playing it again. This might be a coincidence, but whatever else can be said about these projects, one thing is for certain: when compared to upcoming horror FPS Animal Use Protocol, they both featured considerably less monke.
Read more
articles.title: Animal Use Protocol asks: what if we put a happy little rat on Half Life 2’s gravity gun and gave it to a chimpanzee?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Going by three hours with a preview build last month, the Indiana Jones of Indiana Jones And The Great Circle has the hungriest hands this side of Thief 2014. They're always surging into view, reaching restlessly toward objects as you explore, for there is ever so much to touch: photos and letters; pipes, frying pans, and other blunt implements; relics that translate into "Adventure Points", used to "unlock" books of skills; camouflaged levers and other chunks of fusty comicbook exotica that harbour clockwork secrets. Sometimes, Indy's magic fingers help you glean an object you need from the game's religiously-sourced piles of Lucasfilm memorabilia. Sometimes, they exhaust you: please, Dr Jones, for the love of George. Stop trying to pick things up. Let me look at "ancient history" for a while. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones And the Great Circle redefines the gun-toting archaeologist as a grabby Lucasfilm fanboi

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I missed my chance to write about Hollywood Animal when a certain Nic Reuben swooped in like a rival showbiz talent scout and pinched the summer Steam Fest demo from right under my nose, capitalising on the fact that I was stranded in an airport at the time. I wrote about a very rude Minesweeper "homage" instead. Hopefully that was for the best. 


Anyway, it's finally my chance for a bite at the apple, for developers Weappy Wholesome have just given their slice of throwback La La Land an early access release date: January 16th 2025. To celebrate, they've also published a new and fairly lengthy trailer. Grab yourself a scotch and a cigar and dig in.
 
Read more
articles.title: Wildly immoral tinseltown builder Hollywood Animal hits early access in January 2025

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
A number of Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 quality assurance staff from Eden Prarie, Minnesota have walked out in protest over Activision's ending of hybrid or remote working, which was announced in December last year. They're being supported by the Communication Workers Of America union, who claim that Activision are forcing the return to the office on staff "with serious medical conditions and doctor's recommendations to work from home".
 Read more
articles.title: Black Ops 6 QA staff walk out over Activision return to the office policy, which has "unquestionably harmed disabled employees"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Bungie have been fairly quiet about Marathon, the upcoming extraction shooter they announced in 2023. Yesterday they released a devlog in which game director Joe Ziegler seemed to want to reassure fans of the studio that the game was still in development. He talked around a lot of the game features, without actually saying much about it. As yet, there's still no footage of the game in action, making its previous release window of 2025 appear even more tenuous.
Read more
articles.title: Bungie seek to reassure everyone that Marathon is still alive... by saying almost nothing about it

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Spider dislikers, your concerns have been noted. At least by Capcom, anyway. The developers of Monster Hunter Wilds are including an option in the upcoming beast-skinning action RPG that will turn all arachnid style monsters into something much less creepy and/or crawly. 
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds will have a spider-free mode for those with arachnophobia

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Path Of Exile 2's early access release has been shoved back three weeks from 15th November to 6th December 2024, game director Jonathan Rogers has announced in a brief Youtube video. The action-RPG itself will seemingly be ready in time for the original launch date, but there's a load of "server-side infrastructure work" that needs doing.
  
Read more
articles.title: Path Of Exile 2 early access release delayed to December to ensure your POE microtransactions carry over

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
What Remains Of Edith Finch is a very upsetting collection of interactive short stories about the brief, tragic lives of a cursed family who live in a monstrous treehouse. It's also a wonderful show of experimentation, switching genres from story to story - one minute you're a playable bestiary on shuffle, the next you're beheading fish in a cannery as the worktable disappears beneath your scrolling daydreams. The developer's next project seems to be pursuing a similar balance of whimsy and darkness. It's another anthology experience, which casts you as a field biologist studying "the strangeness of organic life". Also, chicken-legged houses.

 
Read more
articles.title: The creators of What Remains Of Edith Finch are making a weird and alarming biology game inspired by Ghibli and Attenborough

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
We've seen beans racing, and penguins racing, but we have not yet seen cats racing. That is because cats will not stoop to such frivolities, where it can be reasonably avoided. Cats are too self-respecting to get caught up in silly online multiplayer party games. Please. Don't insult their intelligence, their divinity, their mastery of the environment and of your emotions. Cats don't need 2-9 player scrambles across the rooms of an eccentric manor house, with customisable outfits and various minigames. What? Jumping Jazz Cats? No. I won't recognise it. This is a work of impossible sedition. Impossible, cute sedition. Pay no attention to the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Jumping Jazz Cats mashes the multiplayer minigames of Fall Guys with Disney's Aristocats

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
It’s always nice to say that a big, look-how-much-we-spent-on-pore-rendering AAA game actually runs quite well on PC, as Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 does. Unfortunately for Bl6ps, and for us, that technical success is balanced on the knife tip of some seriously overwrought infrastructure. Mainly in the form the UX nightmare that is the Call of Duty HQ launcher, as well as a meddlesome always-online requirement, itself serving a feature that doesn’t even work that well.
Read more
articles.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 performs well on PC – shame about the launcher

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You can feel two ways about something at the same time. The feuding academics of Life Is Strange: Double Exposure might call this "emotional superposition". But the word "ambivalent" already exists. So let's say I'm ambivalent about this new adventure featuring Max Caulfield, the returning hero of Life Is Strange, and time-travelling photographer whose powers have resurfaced after years of off-screen atrophy. I've been deeply moved by individual scenes in this sequel. By the end I was sorry to leave its characters behind. At the same time (please now imagine my face is splitting into a second, colour-washed expression with wobbly VFX) I am relieved it's over, so I don't have to deal with the inconsistent behaviour of those characters, the flimsy plot, and a convoluted approach to murder mystery. 
Read more
articles.title: Life Is Strange Double Exposure review: be still my irritated heart

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
If there’s one thing I’d like to get across about my time with Dragon Age: The Veilguard - perhaps a surprise given Bioware’s recent history, Anthem, and some of the early marketing for this game - it’s that in my 50 hour return to Thedas, I very rarely felt I was playing something cynical.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard review: A reluctant RPG, but a compelling, heartfelt action adventure

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In case you don't know the headline reference, Orpheus was a mythical Greek musician who famously descended to the underworld to rescue his snake-bitten lover, Eurydice. The underworld's rulers, Hades and Persephone, were massively bummed out by Orpheus's emo lyre-playing, and swiftly agreed to let him lead Eurydice's soul upward to the waking world, with the extremely simple proviso that he not look back at her till they're both on the surface.
Being a love-drunk spannerhead, however, Orpheus couldn't resist a quick peek at Eurydice after crossing the threshold - and the result is a timeless moral about human frailty and the specific truism that you should absolutely never date musicians, which Australian developers Oppolyon Studios appear to have totally ignored in their otherwise-redolent game about kicking your brother's soul out of hell.
 Read more
articles.title: In Foddian hell-platformer Ascending Inferno, Orpheus is a footballer and Eurydice is a football

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I've often thought lighthouse keeping would make a fine second career, albeit mostly because in my head, it would give me endless time to write (and finish Baldur's Gate 3). You won't have much time to write in Static Dread, sadly. The world has ended, the oceans teem with squirmy, extra-dimensional lifeforms, and it's your job as the apparent sole surviving lighthouse keeper to distinguish vessels loaded with eldritch horrors from vessels loaded with people who need saving from eldritch horrors. 
Going by the teaser trailer, below, this appears to be comparable to playing border guard in Papers, Please, but it's less political and more tentacular. You field queries over the radio, run your finger down a clipboard, and decide whether to kindle the lamps or beg the coastguard to blast that ship back to hell. There's a dialogue line in the trailer which I, personally, would consider highly untrustworthy. "It's consuming my team!" screams a self-described ship captain. "Please, send help! Gosh..." Look, "friend", no genuine human being says "gosh" in an emergency situation. Not even British human beings say "gosh" in an emergency situation. That's what you say when somebody tells you the pizza-flavoured crisps are back on sale at Aldis.
  
Read more
articles.title: Static Dread is Papers, Please but you're a lighthouse keeper besieged by Lovecraftian monsters

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
One of my biggest challenges as a writer has been tempering my love of vague gestures at metaphysical concepts with the revelation that the people who read my articles also, apparently, can’t read my mind. Pah. A skill issue if I ever saw one, honestly. Decade is a fascinating adventure game that drew me in with its apparent vagueness but then, like some sort of considerate, sensible coward, went on to explain itself well in on its Steam page.
It’s the end of the world, and you’re not too happy about it, so you’ll be shoving children in a time machine with little more than a rotting Lunchly and some instructions to help you figure out exactly what went wrong.
What are you dressing as for Halloween? Me, I’m dressing as someone trying to bring back “tray-tray” in an effort to give Edwin a seizure. Here’s the tray-tray:
Read more
articles.title: Decade is a tech-noir adventure game where you send children back in time to prevent metal rain from pulping the planet

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Back in April, I wrote about a hearing that took place between representatives Video Game History Foundation, the Rhizome project, and the Software Preservation Network, in which they argued the case for a DMCA exemption that would allow researchers to remotely access out-of-print games in libraries and archives. Representatives from the Entertainment Software Association (ESA) and the AACS were in opposition, with ESA legal representative Steve Englund at one point fretting about some sort of hellish "online arcade that (he’d) been warning about for the last several proceedings".
Last Friday, as per a statement released by the VGHF and spotted by PC Gamer, the US Copyright Office officially denied the exemption.
Read more
articles.title: The Video Game History Foundation is “not done fighting” after US Copyright Office refuses exemption to aid preservation

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V novinkách pro další verzi linuxového jádra se aktuálně činí AMD, která řeší jak efektivitu chodu Radeonů, tak vylepšení pro svá CPU z hlediska výkonu, efektivity plánování úloh i snižování dopadu oprav na Spectre.
articles.title: Linuxové jádro 6.13 a Mesa 24.3: nejen Vulkan pro 12 let staré Radeony

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt LibreQuake si klade za cíl vytvořit open-source FPS inspirovanou herní legendou Quake. Descent 3: Piccu Engine je fork open-source enginu Descent 3. Firma Nintendo zařízla další emulátor Nintenda Switch Ryujinx.
articles.title: LibreQuake vytváří nový klon Quake, Descent 3 znovu v Piccu Engine

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Vysvětlíme si, jak jsou tenzory uloženy v paměti počítače nebo TPU. Taktéž si ukážeme získání pohledu (view) na tenzor a následně si popíšeme i různé operace, které je možné s tenzory provádět jako s celkem.
articles.title: Manipulace s tenzory v knihovně PyTorch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Vondráček)
articles.description: Na Univerzitě Pardubice jsme se rozhodli nasadit IPv6 only síť na eduroamu. Získané zkušenosti nyní sdílím, protože mi při práci chyběl komplexní návod, který by spojil jednotlivé služby do jednoho řešení.
articles.title: Univerzitní eduroam pouze na IPv6: mechanismy DNS64 a NAT64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme aplikaci pro předpověď počasí, probudíme si počítač po síti, vyzkoušíme si správce hlasitosti pro PipeWire a podíváme se na klienta pro Matrix.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (6. 11. 2024): mrkněte na předpověď počasí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V sobotu 2. listopadu proběhl první den letošní konference OpenAlt. Mluvilo se o digitalizaci stavebního řízení, testování překladače, novinkách v Turrisu či moderním nerozbitném linuxovém systému.
articles.title: Nerozbitný linuxový desktop, testování překladačů a stavební řízení, sobota na OpenAltu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Začneme se zabývat knihovnou PyTorch, která je poměrně intenzivně využívána v oblasti strojového učení (machine learning) a zejména pak hlubokého učení (deep learning).
articles.title: Od projektu Scikit-learn ke knihovně PyTorch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: V tomto blogovém zápisku si ukážeme jiný způsob řízení LED diodové matice na oblíbené vývojářské desce Arduino UNO v revizi 4 Wifi, která kromě jiného přináší i integrovanou diodovou matici 12×8.
articles.title: Řízení diodové matice na Arduino UNO R4 Wifi (jinak)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V dnešním dílu Postřehů si nejprve nebudeme nic dělat z udělení červené karty, (ne)necháme se okrást mezopotámským farmářem, dáme si pozor na ruské šipky, naučíme se vyrábět cihly z jablek a nakonec si zaštěkáme.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: červená karta neplatí, hrajeme dál

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt AlmaLinux oznámil novou vývojovou větev své distribuce jménem Kitten. Projekt KDE se chystá představit vlastní linuxovou distribuci. Vývojáři Ubuntu oznámili, že spouštějí vývoj Ubuntu 25.04 Plucky Puffin.
articles.title: AlmaLinux má testovací verzi Kitten, KDE chystá vlastní distribuci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před pár dny vyšel GIMP 3.0 RC1.  Autoři k tomu napsali obsáhlý příspěvek na blogu. V něm mimo jiné píší, že po vydání verze 3.0 se budou soustředit na menší vydání s novými funkcemi. A že chtějí vydat GIMP 3.2 do roka od vydání 3.0 a ne v roce 2050, což je častým žertem.
articles.title: Gimp 3.2 můžeme prý očekávat do roka od vydání 3.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: CEO OpenAI Sam Altman ve středu oznámil novou doménu chat.com pro ChatGPT. Zajímavé je, jak se k lukrativní doméně dostal. Dharmesh Shah koupil doménu na začátku roku 2023 za 15,5 miliónů dolarů. Tu poté prodal za neupřesněnou částku právě OpenAI.
articles.title: ChatGPT má novou doménu chat.com

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář Intelu Dave Hansen poslal včera do LKML návrh, aby jádro hlásilo zastaralý mikrokód procesoru jako zranitelnost. Dave říká, že v současnosti prakticky není možné provozovat starý mikrokód a zároveň pokládat počítač za bezpečný. Zranitelnost navrhuje zobrazit pomocí „Vulnerable“ pohromadě s ostatními zranitelnostmi v souboru:
articles.title: Intel má úpravu jádra, které bude hlásit starý mikrokód jako zranitelnost

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým zodpovědný za vydání FreeBSD se rozhodl zkrátit dobu podpory z pěti na čtyři roky. Po uplynutí čtyřletého období podpory vydání FreeBSD bude následovat další podpora „v rámci možností“. Tento plán byl podpořen vedením projektu, stejně jako týmem správců balíčků a bezpečnostním týmem.
articles.title: FreeBSD zkracuje podporu z pěti na čtyři roky a pracuje na lepší podpoře notebooků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Pokud chcete provozovat Kubernetes na vlastním hardware, Rancher je jednoduchý a efektivní způsob, jak toho docílit. Umožní vám jednoduše vytvořit a spravovat Kubernets cluster na vlastních virtuálních serverech. Používat Rancher se naučíte na dalším školení Rancher – Kubernetes na vlastním hardware, které proběhne 25. a 26. listopadu a uskuteční se online.
articles.title: Rancher: provozujte Kubernetes na vlastním hardware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Většina jednodeskových počítačů Raspberry Pi, s výjimkou modelů Raspberry Pi Zero a A+, je vybavena vestavěným rozbočovačem USB, který využívá jednu linku USB z procesoru a poskytuje několik dalších portů USB typu A. Někdy je ale potřeba portů ještě více, proto Raspberry Pi uvádí na trh vlastní rozbočovač Raspberry Pi USB 3.
articles.title: Rozbočovač Raspberry Pi USB 3 je v prodeji za 12 dolarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Správce české národní domény, ve spolupráci s organizací ICANN, zprovoznil novou zahraniční DNS lokalitu v Los Angeles ve Spojených státech. Tato lokalita je druhou na západním pobřeží Spojených států, přičemž od roku 2020 má sdružení CZ.NIC také servery v Seattlu. Správce domény .CZ tak pokračuje v rozšiřování své DNS infrastruktury po celém světě a zvyšování odolnosti svého DNS anycastu.
articles.title: CZ.NIC posiluje svůj DNS anycast zprovozněním nové lokality v Los Angeles

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Cloudová divize společnosti Google oznámila, že v rámci snahy o zlepšení zabezpečení účtů zavede do konce roku 2025 povinné vícefaktorové ověřování (MFA) pro všechny uživatele. Povinné MFA pro Google Cloud budeme zavádět postupně a v průběhu roku 2025 se rozšíří na všechny uživatele po celém světě, uvedl v prohlášení Mayank Upadhyay.
articles.title: Google Cloud zavede do konce roku 2025 vícefaktorové ověřování pro všechny uživatele

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnosti Meta dostala v Jižní Koreji pokutu 15,67 milionu dolarů za nezákonné shromažďování a sdílení citlivých údajů uživatelů Facebooku, včetně politických názorů a sexuální orientace. Tyto údaje byly sdíleny s inzerenty bez výslovného souhlasu uživatelů.
articles.title: Jižní Korea udělila Facebooku pokutu za shromažďování a sdílení dat uživatelů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na YouTube byla zveřejněna sestříhaná videa ze všech nahrávaných přednášek letošní konference OpenAlt 2024, která se uskutečnila 2. a 3. listopadu v Brně. Dostat se na ně můžete také z programu na webu akce po kliknutí na přednášku, která vás zajímá. Pustit si je také můžete z následujícího playlistu, jednotlivá videa se přepínají vpravo nahoře.
articles.title: Videa přednášek z OpenAltu 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Protokoly WHOIS a RDAP slouží jako klíčové nástroje pro získávání informací o objektech v registru .cz domén, který spravuje sdružení CZ.NIC. Je důležité, aby tyto služby byly stabilní a dostupné, a aby zvládly zpracovat potřebný objem požadavků i při zvýšeném zatížení. Proto je nezbytné implementovat rate-limiting, který pomáhá zabránit tomu, aby jeden uživatel vyčerpal kapacitu systému, a to nejen v případě útoku typu DoS.
articles.title: CZ.NIC upraví limity na používání služeb WHOIS a RDAP

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Správce linuxových manuálových stránek Alejandro Colomar v září oznámil, že kvůli nedostatku podpory pozastavuje svou práci. Nyní však oznámil, že se podařilo najít finanční prostředky alespoň na příští rok. Po zářijovém oznámení prý cítil velkou podporu a uznání od komunity. Rád bych poděkoval všem, kteří mi vyjádřili podporu a šířili tuto zprávu. Také jsem se mi dostalo velké podpory od malých společností, což mě překvapilo. Nabídly mi, co mohly, abych se mohl vrátit k udržování projektu, píše ve svém mailu.
articles.title: Linuxové manuálové stránky mají zajištěné financování na další rok

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na trh míří už třetí generace osmijádra s přídavnou cache od AMD. Po Ryzenu 5800X3D a 7800X3D se zítra objeví i Ryzen 7 9800X3D, jehož test nyní přinesl Phoronix. Výsledky jsou dle očekávání skvělé: výkon 93 % toho, co nabízí nejvyšší Intel Core Ultra 9 285K, spotřeba o desítky wattů / desítky procent nižší a cenovka … no, na tu si ještě počkejme, ale určitě nebude dosahovat 16 tisíc Kč, na kterých se usadil Intel 285K a kolem kterých se pohybuje i 16jádrový Ryzen 9950X.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D ukazuje skvělý výkon na Linuxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nadcházející balík Mesa 24.3 přinese podporu tzv. „Next-Gen Geometry culling“ pro staré Radeony RDNA1 alias GFX10 alias Navi 10, tedy karty typu Radeon RX 5600 a 5700. Přišlo se na to vlastně náhodou, když se tato technika implementovala pro Navi 21 a u předchozí generace ani nikoho nenapadlo změřit případný pozitivní vliv, na což nyní došlo.
articles.title: S novou verzí Mesa 24.3 mírně zrychlí staré Radeony generace RDNA1

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Linuxové jádro v průběhu let dostalo několik zabezpečovacích vlastností eliminujících riziko teoretického DMA útoku skrze rozhraní Thunderbolt. Ukazuje se, že opatření jsou někdy až zbytečně přísná, a tak jádro Linux 6.13 přinese korekci, který změní logiku nakládání s tímto rozhraním v případech, kdy je řadič pevnou součástí daného počítače.
articles.title: Linuxové jádro 6.13 bude více důvěřovat zabudovaným řadičům rozhraní Thunderbolt

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Grafický editor GIMP dosahuje fáze RC1. Dílčí úkony pro tuto verzi jsou téměř hotovy, chybí víceméně jen kosmetické věci jako zveřejnění tarballů či sestavení binárek, aktualizace pro Microsoft Partner Center a formální oznámení na webu / X / Facebooku apod. Tedy nic, co by se týkalo kódu, ten je hotov.
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 došel do fáze RC1, je čas testovat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Protokol DNS je jedním z nejstarších internetových protokolů, který se zachoval do dneška a na kterém závisí všechny ostatní internetové služby. V našem školení Principy a správa DNS pochopíte, jak přesně funguje a jak ho správně nastavit a zabezpečit. Nejbližší termín školení je 13. listopadu a školení proběhne online.
articles.title: Principy a správa DNS: naučte se pracovat s doménami (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Baví vás elektronika, informační technologie, bastlení nebo obecně technika? Pak i tento měsíc je tady pro vás Virtuální Bastlírna – online setkání hospodského typu všech nadšenců do techniky, organizované projektem MacGyver strahovského studentského klubu SiliconHill.
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 44: jak se budeme bavit se sondou Voyager 1?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na konci října se uskutečnilo setkání s podporovateli serveru Root.cz, které přilákalo skupinku nadšenců do technologií a open-source. Atmosféra byla uvolněná a přátelská, což umožnilo příjemnou diskusi o aktuálních trendech v oblasti IT, vývoji softwaru a dalších zajímavých tématech. Účastníci si užili nejen výměnu názorů, ale také příjemné chvíle u piva.
articles.title: Proběhlo neformální setkání s podporovateli Root.cz

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: eBPF (což už není zkratka pro nic), běžně označovaný také jako BPF, je technologie, která má původ v linuxovém jádře a dokáže spouštět programy v privilegovaném kontextu, jako je jádro operačního systému. Architektura použité instrukční sady byla nyní standardizována v RFC 9669.
articles.title: Instrukční sada BPF je nyní standardizována v RFC 9669

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Arrow Lake máme čerstvě na trhu a tak inženýři Intelu kromě ladění jeho podpory pracují na aktivaci potřebného kódu už i pro generaci následnou, Panther Lake. Do jádra v posledních dnech zamířily patche, které aktivují podporu iGPU příští generace, tedy Xe3.
articles.title: Jádro 6.13 s počáteční podporou zobrazení na Intel Panther Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Součástí nové verze desktopového prostředí LXQt je i nová komponenta lxqt-wayland-session zajišťující jeho běh na Waylandu. Nově tak LXQt podporuje běh na Waylandu nad kompozitory Labwc, KWin, Wayfire, Hyprland, Sway, River a Niri, backend pro nastavení, který je v LXQt-Panel, počítá s použitím KWin.
articles.title: Vydáno prostředí LXQt 2.1 s novou komponentou pro běh na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Divize Mobile Solutions Business Division (Toughbook) společnosti Panasonic Connect Europe oznámila uzavření spolupráce se společností Red Hat. Účelem tohoto partnerství je certifikace zařízení Toughbook pro Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Certifikace přináší flexibilitu zákazníkům požadujícím bezpečná řešení založená na Linuxu, což z ní činí ideální řešení pro státní agentury, dodavatele a systémové integrátory, píše Panasonic v tiskové zprávě.
articles.title: Toughbooky od Panasonicu získaly certifikaci Red Hat Enterprise Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Osmý ročník konference Ověřená řešení v sítích (ORS 2024) se uskuteční již za dva týdny, 21. listopadu 2024 na Obchodně podnikatelské fakultě v Karviné (Univerzitní náměstí 1934/3).
articles.title: Konference Ověřená řešení v sítích proběhne 21. listopadu v Karviné

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Distribuce Manjaro, založená na Arch Linuxu, chystá nový nástroj Manjaro Data Donor (MDD) pro získávání dat o uživatelích. MDD by mělo nahradit současné řešení založené na ping.manjaro.org ke sčítání uživatelů, které má své nedostatky.
articles.title: Manjaro chystá sběr dat pomocí Manjaro Data Donor

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: HP Wolf Security: nové důkazy o útocích prostřednictvím malwaru generovaného AI. Matrix odhalí kvalitu a efektivitu agilního vývoje. Platformové inženýrství může naplnit přísliby přístupu DevOps. Úloha AI v řízení finančních rizik v Evropě. V grafenu poprvé detektovali elektronové víry. Asseco představuje širokou škálu inovací v rámci své mezinárodní skupiny.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: V grafenu poprvé detektovali elektronové víry

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Robotický lovec s umělou inteligencí ochrání kritickou infrastrukturu před útoky dronů . Antihmota v kosmickém záření znovu otevírá otázku temné hmoty v podobě části WIMP. Asteroid, který vyhubil dinosaury, mohl současně odstartovat zemědělství mravenců.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Sonda Psyche opět posunula rekord v laserové komunikaci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 44/2024

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Už vás unavuje sedět za pirátskými „Windows, nebo se dívat na otravné připomínky k aktivaci? Dobře, máme pro vás dobrou zprávu – právě teď, při oslavě nadcházenícího Black Friday, se prodávají klíče k Windows 10 a and Windows 11 s obrovskými slevami. Dále máme zvláštní promokód, který udělá ceny ještě lákavějšími.
articles.title: Získejte u Goodoffer24 na Black Friday Windows 10 jen za €14, Windows 11 za €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rekapitulace nových vydání linuxových a BSD distribucí: vyšel nový Linux Mint, Nobara Project, balík distribucí LinuxSchools či stabilní Vanilla OS 2, aktualizovány byly Peppermint OS, Finnix, Raspberry Pi OS, Clonezilla Live, NomadBSD, OpenMandriva ROME, Tails, KaOS, OPNsense a MidnightBSD. Naopak prakticky skončil projekt Funtoo.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 27-30/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Pouze 11 % ředitelů IT oddělení firem plně implementovalo umělou inteligenci. Mají obavy o data a bezpečnost. Gitex Global 2024: Huawei představila nová řešení a vyzdvihla partnerský ekosystém. Malé a střední podniky si mohou nechat otestovat svá řešení AI. Fortinet rozšiřuje svou nabídku zabezpečení v cloudu představením Lacework FortiCNAPP. Sophos představil nové výkonné desktopové firewally řady XGS.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Malé a střední podniky si mohou nechat otestovat svá řešení AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 43/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rezonátory prodlužují životnost qubitů v kvantových počítačích. Umělá inteligence se snaží porozumět štěkotu psů. Temelín testuje brýle s rozšířenou realitou.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: I Nobelova cena za chemii je vlastně za umělou inteligenci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Taktik roste. Western Digital dodává pevné disky ePMR s nejvyšší kapacitou na světě. V IT dochází ke slučování rolí, mzdy ale stagnují. HP Scan AI Enhanced umožňuje digitalizaci pracovních postupů. TSMC plánuje další závody v Evropě, ve hře je i Česko. Umělá inteligence bude v roce 2030 vytvářet 3,5 % globálního HDP.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: TSMC plánuje další závody v Evropě, ve hře je i Česko

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 42/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Robotický lovec s umělou inteligencí ochrání kritickou infrastrukturu před útoky dronů. Antihmota v kosmickém záření znovu otevírá otázku temné hmoty v podobě části WIMP. Asteroid, který vyhubil dinosaury, mohl současně odstartovat zemědělství mravenců.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Sonda Psyche opět posunula rekord v laserové komunikaci

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Dnes v 17:00 má na YouTube online premiéru krátký film Project Gold od Blender Studia představující možnosti rozšíření Blenderu pro "malířský vzhled".
articles.title: Project Gold od Blender Studia

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 8.0 (𝕏) frameworku pro vývoj webových aplikací Ruby on Rails (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu, v poznámkách k vydání a na GitHubu.
articles.title: Ruby on Rails 8.0

articles.author: JZD
articles.description: Byla vydána verze R14.1.3 desktopového prostředí Trinity Desktop Environment (TDE, fork KDE 3.5, Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání, podrobnosti v seznamu změn.
articles.title: Trinity Desktop Environment (TDE) R14.1.3

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl představen oficiální Raspberry Pi USB 3 Hub. Cena je 12 dolarů.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi USB 3 Hub

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na YouTube byly zveřejněny sestříhané videozáznamy přednášek z letošního OpenAltu. Dostupné jsou také přímo z programu po kliknutí na přednášku.
articles.title: Sestříhané videozáznamy z konference OpenAlt 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Co přesně se děje, když se pomocí curlu připojujeme ke google.com? Proč to psát do terminálu, když si to můžeme pustit jako videoklip curl -v https://google.com na YouTube. 😂
articles.title: curl -v https://google.com

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Open source platforma Home Assistant (Demo, GitHub, Wikipedie) pro monitorování a řízení inteligentní domácnosti byla vydána ve verzi 2024.11.
articles.title: Home Assistant 2024.11

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Oficiálně byla vydána (Mastodon, 𝕏) první RC verze GIMPu 3.0. Přehled novinek v oznámení o vydání. Podrobně v souboru NEWS na GitLabu.
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 RC1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Hodnota Bitcoinu, decentralizované kryptoměny překonala 75 000 dolarů (1 770 157 korun).
articles.title: Hodnota Bitcoinu překonala 75 000 dolarů

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 8.11.0 řádkového nástroje a knihovny pro přenos dat po různých protokolech curl. S oficiální podporou WebSocket. Opravena byla bezpečnostní chyba CVE-2024-9681.
articles.title: curl 8.11.0

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week Google announced the general availability of their C4A instances powered by their in-house Axion processors. I delivered launch-day benchmarks looking at the Google Axion CPU performance with the C4A instances compared to other Google Cloud instance types powered by Ampere Altra and Intel Xeon. In this article is a look at how the Google Axion processor performance compares to the competing Amazon/AWS Graviton4 processor.
articles.title: Google Axion CPU With GCE C4A vs. AWS Graviton4 Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this year was a Fedora change proposal seeking to make KDE Plasma the default over GNOME for Fedora 42. A compromise of sorts has now been settled on with the Fedora Desktop Spin being promoted to an "Edition" status that will put it on the same level as the GNOME-based Fedora Workstation Edition...
articles.title: Fedora KDE Desktop Spin Promoted To Same Tier As GNOME-Based Fedora Workstation

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's Linux kernel test robot has reported a 3888.9% performance improvement in the mainline Linux kernel as of this past week...
articles.title: Intel Spots A 3888.9% Performance Improvement In The Linux Kernel From One Line Of Code

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa 24.3 feature development is now over and Mesa 25.0 has entered development with Mesa Git...
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 Code Branched, Mesa 25.0 Enters Development

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As the latest on the compiler enablement front for Intel's next-gen Xeon "Diamond Rapids processors, LLVM Git has merged support for the AMX-AVX512 instructions for next spring's Clang 20 compiler release...
articles.title: AMX-AVX512 Support Merged For LLVM Clang 20 Compiler

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A patch posted on Thursday by one of Intel's long-time Linux kernel engineers would begin treating outdated Intel CPU microcode as a security vulnerability that would be reported to user-space via the existing sysfs vulnerabilities reporting...
articles.title: Intel Linux Patch Would Report Outdated CPU Microcode As A Security Vulnerability

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" testing over the past month since launch I have looked at how well the new EPYC Turin CPUs compete against Intel Xeon, how Turin Dense dominates in performance and power efficiency to AmpereOne at 192 cores, and the generational uplift from EPYC Genoa to Turin at the same core counts, among other Turin performance benchmark tests. Up for comparison today is a look at how the NVIDIA Grace CPU performance within the GH200 Superchip compares to the AMD EPYC Turin processors.
articles.title: NVIDIA GH200 Grace CPU vs. AMD EPYC 9005 Turin CPU Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sent out yesterday was an AMDGPU/AMDKFD kernel driver pull request with the last few feature additions and patches slated for the upcoming Linux 6.13 kernel merge window. Alongside other AMD kernel graphics driver updates, the new driver code with Radeon RX 7000 series RDNA3 graphics cards will finally allow controlling the zero RPM fan feature under Linux...
articles.title: Linux 6.13 To Allow Controlling Zero RPM Feature For Radeon RX 7000 Series GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The FreeBSD project issued today their Q3'2024 progress report to outline enhancements made to this open-source BSD operating system over the prior quarter...
articles.title: FreeBSD Reduces OS Support From 5 To 4 Years, Continues Collaboration With AMD

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While old Radeon GFX6/GFX7 era graphics processors are no longer actively supported by AMD on Windows and haven't been for quite a while, under Linux with the upstream open-source driver stack they remain supported and still enjoying improvements in large part from common code. The most recent fascinating aspect is the old AMD GFX6/GFX7 era GPUs seeing official Vulkan 1.3 support that has been deemed conformant by Khronos...
articles.title: Mesa RADV Driver Delivers Conformant Vulkan 1.3 Support For Old AMD GFX6/GFX7 GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Haiku open-source operating system project inspired by BeOS has remained very active implementing more features and fixes as we approach the end of 2024...
articles.title: Haiku Enjoyed A Busy October Implementing More Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yet another feature merging into Mesa 24.3 with the code branching (feature freeze) yet to take place is Vulkan FIFO presentation mode support under Wayland...
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 Merges Vulkan FIFO Support On Wayland

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Near the end of October OpenCL 3.0.17 was released as the newest maintenance update to this low-level compute API for cross-vendor GPUs and other accelerators. The OpenCL Headers and SDK have now been updated for the new revision...
articles.title: OpenCL Headers & SDK Updated For OpenCL 3.0.17

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AMD ROCm 6.2.4 is out today as the newest point release for this Radeon and Instinct open-source GPU compute stack...
articles.title: AMD ROCm 6.2.4 Released With Radeon PRO V710 Support & Documentation Updates

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the GIMP 3.0-RC1 tagging, the GIMP project has now put out their lengthy write-up outlining many of the new features to enjoy with this first release candidate of the much anticipated GIMP 3.0. Plus there is a few words about future releases when moving past the upcoming GIMP 3.0 stable...
articles.title: GIMP 3.2 Will Aim To Be Out Within One Year Of GIMP 3.0

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linux I/O expert and block/IO_uring maintainer Jens Axboe of Meta has recently revisited his patches around uncached buffered I/O. Back in 2019 the "RWF_UNCACHED" effort was started by Axboe to address a throughput cliff in performance once the page cache fills up. That work faded away but Axboe recently took to crafting a set of fresh patches for implementing uncached buffered I/O and they are showing extremely promising results...
articles.title: Fresh Take On Linux Uncached Buffered I/O "RWF_UNCACHED" Nets 65~75% Improvement

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Systemd 257-rc1 is out today as a big feature update for this release that brings many new features and other refinements to this key piece of the Linux operating system stack...
articles.title: systemd 257-rc1 Released With A Ton Of New Features & Changes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ahead of tomorrow's availability of the AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D processor as the first Zen 5 CPU released with 3D V-Cache, today the review embargo lifts. Here is a look at how this 8-core / 16-thread Zen 5 CPU with 64MB of 3D V-Cache is performing under Ubuntu Linux compared to a variety of other Intel Core and AMD Ryzen desktop processors.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D Linux Performance: Zen 5 With 3D V-Cache

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.description: Typically in my launch-day Linux reviews of new AMD EPYC processors I try to include results both of the performance determinism (default) and power determinism modes available with these server processors since opting in to the power determinism mode can allow for additional performance uplift at the cost of slightly higher power costs. With the AMD EPYC 9575F / 9755 / 9965 benchmarks and review I didn't have a chance to complete all of the power determinism runs in time for that review, but for those curious about power vs. performance determinism modes with the 5th Gen AMD EPYC "Turin" processors, here is a side-by-side comparison.

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Palworld developers Pocketpair has revealed finer details of the lawsuit filed against them by Pokemon-makers Nintendo, and it certainly doesn't look suitable for the latter.


It has long been suspected that Nintendo could move to court against Pocketpair ever since Palworld was released for the first time. It finally happened earlier this year, but the details of the legal proceedings have remained hidden till today. Based on what's been revealed by Pocketpair, they're facing charges of potential infringements of three patents. Surprisingly, all three patents in question appear to have been filed after the game's release.


Palworld makers Pocketpair face a stiff battle with Nintendo


As per Nintendo and The Pokemon Company, Pocketpair's Palworld has reportedly infringed upon three pate…
articles.title: Palworld developer reveals exact patent infringements, and it doesn’t look nice for Nintendo

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
It’s hard to believe that the first Assassin’s Creed game was released almost 20 years ago in 2007, introducing us to Altaïr, the animus, and a lot of the other mechanics involved in the franchise. I feel both old and honored to have been around and gaming at the time.


While the first Assassin’s Creed was a revelation (yes, I realize what I just did), the franchise has come a long way since then. Origins introduced a new, open-world, RPG based gameplay style that attracted a lot of players who had never played before, and we’ve traveled through multiple historical time periods alongside now classic characters.


Whether you were around from the beginning, or you joined the fan-club later with releases such as Origins, Odyssey, or Valhalla, none of the Assassin’s Creed games can be descri…
articles.title: The Top 5 Assassin’s Creed Games, ranked

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC is now live in EA FC 25, and you can obtain a special card of the Kiwi forward for your Ultimate Team squad. 


This is the first occasion where Wood has received a special card in Ultimate Team, and it's all due to his performances in the Premier League. He has been in scintillating form for his club, which has resulted in him winning the best footballer for the previous month. Let's take a look at how you can complete the challenge to add the item to your squad.


EA FC 25 Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC solutions


The Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC has four different tasks, and here are the conditions. 


Task1 - 80-Rate Squad



Min. Team Rating: 80



Solution



11 80-rated items



Task 2 - 81-Rated Squad



Min. Team Rating: 80



Solution



11 81-rated items



Task 3 - Top Form



Min. 1 Players: Team of the Week


Min. Team Rating: 82



Solution



10 82-rated items


1 81-rated TOTW item



Task 4 - Premier League



Min. 1 Players from: Premier League


Min. Team Rating: 83



Solution



Any 10 83-rated items


Gakpo 83



Should you complete the Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC in EA FC 25


Let's first take a look at the key stats of the card. 


Attributes
Ratings




Overall
85


Pace
83


Shooting
88


Passing
76


Dribbling
85


Defense
50


Physicality
87






The overall rating is a tad lower than my expectations, but the SBC is pretty cheap to complete. That said, the requirement of a single TOTW item feels stiff for my liking, but this Wood card is pretty interesting. While it's not exactly meta, the card offers Target Forward++, and the Power Header+ playstyle. The inclusion of Press Proven, First Touch, and Finesse Shot are all great additions on a target man. 


That said, better Pace (83) and a higher overall rating would have made the card much more popular in the community. 

The post EA FC 25: How to complete Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 25: How to complete Chris Wood Premier League POTM SBC

The Ballon d'Or Completionist objective marks the start of a new celebration in EA FC 25, and you can earn plenty of rewards for free to improve your Ultimate Team squad.


Everyone who has logged into the game on November 8 will have received two global loans featuring the stars from men's and women's Ballon d'Or. These loan items will be available for the next four days, and you can use the cards in all game modes. That said, their primary purpose is to help you complete the Ballon d'Or Completionist objective and unlock several rewards along the way.


EA FC 25 Ballon d'Or Completionist objective guide


The Ballon d'Or Completionist objective has ten different tasks to complete over the next four days, so it's not going to be extremely simple. In fact, all ten tasks have different cond…

articles.description:
Pokemon TCG Pocket offers you different ways to get cards, and Mew is one of those rare items that can be unlocked for free without having to open any packs.


Usually, getting a full art card is very difficult inside the game, as you're relying on your pack luck. That's where the Mew item feels different - it's one of those rare full art cards that have no essence of luck at all. However, the game doesn't exactly tell you on your face about how to get this specific card. That said, it's relatively easy, and you can get your hand on the item pretty quickly.


How to get Mew in Pokemon TCG Pocket


Mew's full art card is a reward for completing your Kanto dex. In simpler words, you can find the card by obtaining all 150 Kanto cards that are currently available in Pokemon TCG Pocket. The bes…

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Group passwords are the backbone of Elden Ring's multiplayer scene. Whether you and our friends are playing the game's box-standard multiplayer mode or using one of the many incredible mods fans have made to trick it out, you'll need passwords to explore the Land Between as a team.


Luckily, group passwords are much more than a way to join a group for cooperative multiplayer or PVP. Many Elden Ring group passwords significantly buff the number of Runes you get when you defeat one of the game's shard-bearing bosses. Some of these passwords give you a boost of up to 5%, so you and your friends could end up squeezing a few more level-ups out of the game's most epic bosses.


Specific passwords also come with other effects, including unique summon signs, varying amounts of bloodstains, and th…
articles.title: Best Elden Ring group passwords

articles.description:
The Carpenter profession is one of the most useful in Brighter Shores, and it will have plenty of applications as you explore the Hopeforest region.


The Hopeforest region is distinctly different from Hopeport, and as the name suggests, there are plenty of trees. Naturally, you'll be using the Woodcutter and Carpenter professions quite a lot. Doing so will level up both professions, but you'll want to gain as much XP as possible to unlock new possibilities in terms of items you can create.


Brighter Shores Carpenter profession explained


The Carpenter profession, linked closely with the Woodcutter profession, allows you to process the raw wood. This will help you create valuable items that can have different uses in quests, and you can always sell them for money. Most of the wooden reci…
articles.title: Brighter Shores Carpenter Leveling guide: How to level up fast

The highly anticipated Warzone and Black Ops 6 integration is just around the corner, heralding a new era for CoD's free-to-play version. This momentous event not only marks the introduction of the first season for BO6 but also brings a host of improvements for Warzone fans.


To give you the latest deets on this arrival, here's when the new Warzone will come out in Black Ops 6.


Black Ops 6 Warzone release date


The Warzone and BO6 integration begins on Nov. 14, 2024. You'll likely need to download a fairly sizeable patch for this upcoming update, so make sure to set aside some room in your storage. Pre-loads usually come out a few days beforehand to get you better prepared for its launch.


Once the integration is live, you'll be able to explore the new Warzone map, Area 99, a fascinat…

One of the several quests in Brighter Shores' main storyline involves finding a Giant Crystal in the Hopeforest location, and this mission can be pretty hard to complete.


The nature of the quests changes radically once you get to the second episode, and Hopefrost is filled with corruption. Driving the corruption away can be a difficult job, and you'll realize that as soon as you find the Giant Crystal of the corruption. That said, knowing what to do will make your life a lot easier.


All Giant Crystal items locations in Brighter Shores


The Giant Crystal of Hopeforest is part of the Nullify the Corruption Quest, and it requires you to find some specific item. This quest is part of the main storyline, so you can't miss it by any chance. Before starting the quest, make sure to open the M…

articles.description:
Grinding in Brighter Shores will undoubtedly get tedious over time, especially when you have to level up each Profession. Fortunately, you can use two handy tricks to make it feel less monotonous, saving you a whole of time. Here's how to AFK XP farm in Brighter Shores.


Brighter Shores AFK XP farming guide


To AFK XP farm in Brighter Shores, you can create concoctions at the Apothecary shop or utilize a Passive Activity. The second option allows you to accumulate XP even when you're not actively playing Brighter Shores. However, if you're just starting out, the Apothecary method is a good way to get a head start, as the Passive Activity requires a significant amount of grinding to unlock.


Acquring materials for the Apothecary Profession is the first thing you need to do for this metho…
